newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Amity slips on Ningbing well report.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Amity slips on Ningbing well report.

text.p: The shares of Amity Oil NL fell sharply on Friday following a progress report from its Ningbing-2 well onshore Western Australia, which said that oil bearing sandstones found by the well were tight.
At 11.40 a.m. (0140 GMT), Amity shares were 14 cents weaker at 70 cents on turnover of 102,640 shares.
"The report said the sandstone was tight and this accounts for the stock's fall today," a dealer from a Perth broker said.
The Ning-bing-2 progress report said indications from the well showed the sandstones with encouraging oil shows between 400 and 490 metres in depth were tight.
Last month Amity shares soared on promising reports from its Waggon Creek-1A well which was drilled in the same area. The well was plugged after finding a water saturated section.
Amity has an 80 percent interest in the EP386 joint venture, the other parties being Anthony Barton Pty Ltd with 10 percent and GeoPetro Co 10 percent.
